parameters: \pop[2]As we exit the car, we take a collective breath of fresh air.
\pop[2]For some reason it's the freshest air I've ever experienced in my life.
\pop[2]As we start walking, the fire, and warmth, is our immediate destination.
\pop[2]It feels like the danger has finally dissipated, and we're actually safe.
\pop[2]Honestly, that was a \c[14]long\c[0] drive, so I'm glad that we're finally here.
\pop[2]Good thing Isaac's car let us pass the wall like that.
\pop[2]And even better thing that Kyron got the fire ready...
\pop[3]That's what I thought when I saw the \c[14]city\c[0] for the first time.
Normal for you can be \c[14]life-changing\c[0] for someone else.
That's a good way to put it.
I know how to tell if I'm being followed.
Came with being \c[23]Hermes\c[0], and hiding from \c[10]Argus\c[0].
\pop[3]How much hiding did you do, exactly?
\pop[4]Oh, man. You should've seen this story from my perspective.
So many close calls, it was basically like a movie.
\pop[3]I'm \c[14]so\c[0] glad you waited until now to tell us that.
\pop[3]I'm still getting over what happened in the atrium.
Can't believe I talked them down like that.
\pop[4]It's just like I told you, Dante.
You could change the world with your words.
\pop[4]And by saving me, I think you might've done \c[14]just\c[0] that.
I was terrified, but I knew I could trust you.
\pop[4]I \c[14]told\c[0] you that you'd be thankful for this car one day.
Might not hurt to have a little more \c[14]faith\c[0] next time.
\pop[2]He starts to laugh, but quickly winces in pain.
\pop[3]Funny. But save the wisecracks for later.
You gotta rest up, and get better.
\pop[3]I wouldn't mind taking a look around.
I've always wondered what the colonies were like.
\pop[2]The rest of us stick by Kyron, who continues to tend to the fire.
\pop[2]Gotta say, he definitely knew what he was doing. The warmth is appreciated.
\pop[2]We all sit down, finding solace in the peace of where we are.
\pop[3]Isaac, we've gotta talk about that drive.
Otherwise we'll all be in danger.
\pop[3]That's part of why I got this fire ready.
Right now, he's not in harm's way. We \c[14]won\c[0].
You might just make his vision come true.
\pop[3]And not just him, but I think we'd \c[14]all\c[0] be in danger.
We hurt \c[10]Argus\c[0]. We don't need to anger them \c[14]more\c[0].
\pop[4]You know, I'm pretty tempted to see what's on the drive.
\pop[3]Same. But the stakes are too high.
\pop[4]You know, I totally thought I'd die today.
I had no guarantee that I could make my vision a reality.
\pop[4]So, I accepted my death a long time ago.
If I could leak these secrets, my life might be worth it.
Look at how \c[14]bright\c[0] the future is right now.
\pop[3]Those secrets could just cause more chaos.
You have no idea what you'd be unleashing.
\pop[4]Like I said, just let me think.
Are you okay with giving me some time?
\pop[3]Sure. Not like we've got anywhere else to go.
I'm gonna make like Taylor, and take a look around.
\pop[2]As soon as Dante finishes speaking, we all stand up except for Isaac.
\pop[2]I guess we'd have some time to waste while Isaac made up his mind.
\pop[2]But I know that he'd make the right choice, so I'm not too worried.
\pop[2]My eyes are directed toward Taylor, who's walking around some nearby trees.
\pop[2]As much as I want to check out the cabin, I feel the need to talk to him.
\pop[2]I'm still confused by what happened, and what went through his mind.
\pop[2]Why ditch us, only to return and save the day?
\pop[2]With that question in mind, I slowly approach him.
